snippet: With just three weeks until the so-called sequester cuts are due to take effect, the White House presented its notice as simply prudent planning, not an act of pessimism or an attempt to raise the pressure on lawmakers.
abstract: With just three weeks until the so-called sequester cuts are due to take effect, the White House presented its notice as simply prudent planning, not an act of pessimism or an attempt to raise the pressure on lawmakers.
lead_paragraph: The White House sent a notice to federal agencies this week telling them to prepare for the possibility of deep automatic spending cuts at the end of the year, but President Obama’s spokesman said he remained confident he can reach a deal with Congress to avoid that.

headline.main: White House Warns Agencies of Impending Cuts
